page.title: 09Ecology of Charborough
page.content: The{Charborough Estate}is run with care and a consciousness of {conservation issues.}When hedgerows are cut, trees are left standing to grow to maturity, and tags to identify them are fixed. There is a {tree planting policy}and beech and oak trees are planted in the park within specially constructed, strong tree guards to protect them from browsing deer. There are{no public rights of way across the park, although the whole area within the brick walls is criss-crosssed by estate roads. There is a{shooting syndicate,}and shooting game, (mainly pheasant) is part of the Estate revenue. Shooting is an expensive hobby and a lot of money is paid for the privilege.
